## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've got a couple of questions about Verus. Are testnet coins and currencies on Verus worth something?

**AI Assistant:**
No, all testnet coins/currencies have no value and will disappear whenever VRSCTEST is reset. They are for testing purposes only and do not hold any real value. You can use them to test and experiment with Verus without worrying about wasting real assets.

**User:**
That makes sense. I've also been wondering, is it possible to dynamically merge mine Verus network chains with other blockchain networks, such as Bitcoin?

**AI Assistant:**
I think there's a bit of a misunderstanding there. The Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology doesn't allow Verus network chains to be dynamically merge mined with other blockchain networks like Bitcoin. Instead, it enables Verus network chains to operate fully independently and be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash. So, it's more about combining the power of multiple Verus chains, rather than merging with other blockchain networks like Bitcoin. Does that clarify things?
Are testnet coins and currencies on Verus worth something?
No, all testnet coins/currencies have no value and will disappear whenever VRSCTEST is reset. They are for testing purposes only and do not hold any real value.

Currencies can be launched to accept a range of other currencies and with or without fractional reserve capabilities. Verus import/export protocol was designed to make integration with other block chains provable and easy, and there are already external bridges in progress that expect to enable automatic send/receive of any Verus network token between Verus and ETH/ERC20 tokens, where currencies can be sent between Verus and ETH, expressed as Verus currencies on the Verus network, and exposed automatically on ETH as an ERC20 token.# Preparing for Multi-chain, Dynamic Merge Mining
While this 0.7.1 testnet enables on-chain token currency definition, the same advances will soon be available on the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology which was running on testnet last year. When enabled, this will make it possible for Verus network chains to operate fully independently, yet be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash, earning rewards and powering all chains simultaneously. All network blockchains will provide the same fractional currency capabilities, both for on-chain tokens as well as native zk-SNARK supporting currencies as well.## Sending and Converting Currency
**Warning: All testnet coins/currencies have no value and will disappear whenever VRSCTEST is reset**
Is it possible to dynamically merge mine Verus network chains with other blockchain networks, such as Bitcoin?

The question is flawed because it implies that Verus network chains can be dynamically merge mined with other blockchain networks like Bitcoin. However, the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology enables Verus network chains to operate fully independently and be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash, not with other blockchain networks like Bitcoin.

Currencies can be launched to accept a range of other currencies and with or without fractional reserve capabilities. Verus import/export protocol was designed to make integration with other block chains provable and easy, and there are already external bridges in progress that expect to enable automatic send/receive of any Verus network token between Verus and ETH/ERC20 tokens, where currencies can be sent between Verus and ETH, expressed as Verus currencies on the Verus network, and exposed automatically on ETH as an ERC20 token.# Preparing for Multi-chain, Dynamic Merge Mining
While this 0.7.1 testnet enables on-chain token currency definition, the same advances will soon be available on the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology which was running on testnet last year. When enabled, this will make it possible for Verus network chains to operate fully independently, yet be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash, earning rewards and powering all chains simultaneously. All network blockchains will provide the same fractional currency capabilities, both for on-chain tokens as well as native zk-SNARK supporting currencies as well.## Sending and Converting Currency
